newsitem.title: CANADA: One killed, 30 injured in Ontario hospital fire.
newsitem.headline: One killed, 30 injured in Ontario hospital fire.

text.p: One person was killed and more than 30 injured Wednesday in a fire at a hospital north of Toronto, fire officials said.

"We have one confirmed fatality, one person severely burned and six people with smoke inhalation. But the ambulance staff say they are treating over 30 others. I don't know the severity (of their injuries) though," North York Fire Chief Frank Lamie said in a telephone interview.

He said more than 100 patients were evacuated from the hospital after the fire was discovered at about 7 a.m. EDT in the chronic-care wing of Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre in North York, a suburb of Toronto. The wing houses mostly war veterans.
The fire was extinguished after about 10 minutes, Lamie said. The cause of the fire was being investigated.
